item.title: From Megabit Copper to Gigabit Fiber
item.description:
By: John Shepler It’s clear that upgrading your WAN bandwidth is necessary due to two significant factors. Firstly, network traffic is consistently growing. Secondly, traditional copper-based services are being phased out by providers. This makes it an opportune time to transition to gigabit fiber. Reasons to Upgrade The IT landscape has transformed significantly. In the past, computing resources were mainly on-site, requiring minimal external connections. However, the paradigm has shifted. Now, most computing relies on cloud-based resources, demanding extensive connectivity...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/from-megabit-copper-to-gigabit-fiber/
